Articles.Content: My username is what I normally use for basically everything, and my profile pic is the center part of the flag I use in game. It has 5 of my first 6 crafts built in the full game, posed near the launch pad. The two planes aren’t really visible on the profile pic though.

Tesla because I write books in NaNoWriMo, and my main character is called Tesla. That was my “game name” for some time.

Penguin because I love penguins. Duh.

I used to keep it to just “TeslaPenguin”, but I felt like I needed a number.

 

My profile picture is a penguin, two of my model rockets, and an SSTO that I built.

My username: I used to play a lot of racing games, so my username was RealRacer3. When I got Minecraft and created an Xbox live account, someone already had that name, so I added an x to the end. When I created a KSP forum account, I decided to replace ‘Racer’ with ‘Kerbal’.

My profile pic: It’s just a kerbal (I forgot his name ) on EVA in LKO. I thought it was quite nice. My old one was a GIF of a Kerbal re-entering Kerbin’s atmosphere. I might go back to that one, because it was quite funny

"mouse" has been a nickname of mine since high-school. "Spaaaaaaaaace" is a direct reference to the Space Core from Portal 2 who seems to be equally obsessed with space as I. I've used some others in the past, but i use this pretty much everywhere now.

I should probably make a simple mouse in a spacesuit in Blender, for a profile pic. Maybe one day. XD

Edited October 11, 2018 by SpaceMouse

username: well ive already posted this so...

Quote

in primary school i originally used  shadow2778 when entering games and stuff like that but when some members of the class were playing online chess i decided to join the lobby and called myself guesswho 2778 and i guess i stuck with it

avatar: i honestly dont know it just... happend
My username is the same, I've just changed the avatar to basically reflect me IRL at the moment
Delta was always my favorite greek letter and I though "dizzy" went well with it. My current avatar is a drawing someone made on the outside of one of my brother's birthday presents.

Fraston was a fictional robot character I made up as a young child, he sticks with me and is almost everything as a username. My avatar (currently) is my character in Starbound, and is Fraston himself, but in pixels.
